item.title: Bachelor's Degree Capstone Project: Incident Response Plan part 4
item.description: Section 4: Asset Security Management Security practitioners face many issues when determining best how to secure an organization, but asset management is among the most challenging and the most critical. One cannot protect what one does not know exists. A properly executed IT Asset Management program could mean the difference between a well run network and a hodgepodge of poor documentation that creates easily access footholds for attackers. At a minimum, an IT Asset Management program should track the authorized equipment on the network and the information that describes it, including location, user info, configurations, and roles and responsibility (Brien, 2016).

item.title: Bachelor's Degree Capstone Project: Incident Response Plan part 3
item.description: Section 3: Network Security Incident Response is merely a piece of the puzzle when looking at the larger picture of network security. Each piece of a defensive strategy should complement and be complemented by each other piece. No piece should be isolated, and no piece should represent a single point of failure. Incident Response is no different, and is dependent upon the strategies that come before it, and informs those that come after.
